holidays.name: Fresh Veggies Day 🥒
holidays.description: A day to celebrate the crunch, flavor, and health benefits of fresh vegetables. Whether you love carrots, cucumbers, or kale, this day encourages you to eat more of nature's tasty green gifts.
holidays.origin: Originating as a health awareness event promoting nutritious eating, Fresh Veggies Day encourages people to replace junk food with vibrant, fresh veggies.
holidays.funFact: Did you know that some vegetables like carrots actually taste sweeter after being chilled in the fridge? Perfect for a fresh snack!

holidays.name: Bloomsday 🌸
holidays.description: Celebrated primarily in Dublin and around the world, Bloomsday honors the life and work of Irish writer James Joyce by retracing the steps of his novel's hero, Leopold Bloom, through the city.
holidays.origin: The day is named after the main character in Joyce’s 'Ulysses,' which is set entirely on June 16, 1904, Joyce's real-life date of first meeting his wife.
holidays.funFact: Fans sometimes dress in Edwardian-era clothes and enjoy Irish food, reading passages from 'Ulysses' while wandering Dublin's streets.

holidays.name: Go Fishing Day 🎣
holidays.description: A quirky day dedicated to grabbing your fishing rod and spending time by the water, whether for a relaxing solo trip or a fun outing with friends and family.
holidays.origin: Started by recreational fishing enthusiasts aiming to promote the calm and joy that only fishing can deliver.
holidays.funFact: Fishing legends say that June is one of the best months because many fish species are active and plentiful during this season.

holidays.name: Fudge Day 🍫
holidays.description: A sweet celebration for fudge lovers everywhere! Indulge in all kinds of fudge — from classic chocolate to peanut butter and beyond.
holidays.origin: Unofficial food holiday created by confectioners and fudge shops to boost summer treat sales.
holidays.funFact: The world’s largest piece of fudge weighed over 3,000 pounds — surely a record meant for serious sweet tooths!
